reactor.kafka.sender

Interface TransactionManager


  • public interface TransactionManager

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <T> Mono<T> abort()
      Aborts the current transaction.
      <T> Mono<T> begin()
      Begins a new transaction.
      <T> Mono<T> commit()
      Commits the current transaction.
      Scheduler scheduler()
      Returns the scheduler associated with this transaction instance.
      <T> Mono<T> sendOffsets(java.util.Map<TopicPartition,OffsetAndMetadata> offsets, java.lang.String consumerGroupId)
      Sends provided offsets to the consumer offsets topic.

    • Method Detail

      • begin

        <T> Mono<T> begin()
        Begins a new transaction. See KafkaProducer.beginTransaction() for more details. No other operations may be performed on this sender while this begin operation is in progress.

        Example usage: 

         
 transactionManager = kafkaSender.transactionManager();
 transactionManager.begin()
                   .then(kafkaSender.send(outboundFlux))
                   .then(transactionManager.commit());
        Returns:
        empty Mono that completes when the transaction has started

      • sendOffsets

        <T> Mono<T> sendOffsets(java.util.Map<TopicPartition,OffsetAndMetadata> offsets,
                        java.lang.String consumerGroupId)
        Sends provided offsets to the consumer offsets topic. Offsets are updated within the current transaction. See KafkaProducer.sendOffsetsToTransaction(Map, String) for details on updating consumer offsets within a transaction.
        Parameters:
        offsets - Consumer offsets to update
        consumerGroupId - The consumer group id for which offsets are updated
        Returns:
        empty Mono that completes when the offsets have been sent to the consumer offsets topic. The offsets will be committed when the current transaction is committed.

      • commit

        <T> Mono<T> commit()
        Commits the current transaction. See KafkaProducer.commitTransaction() for details.
        Returns:
        empty Mono that completes when the transaction is committed.

      • abort

        <T> Mono<T> abort()
        Aborts the current transaction. See KafkaProducer.abortTransaction() for details.
        Returns:
        empty Mono that completes when the transaction is aborted.

      • scheduler

        Scheduler scheduler()
        Returns the scheduler associated with this transaction instance. All transactional operations on this transaction and the parent KafkaSender are published on this scheduler. This scheduler is configured using SenderOptions.scheduler(Scheduler) and it must be single threaded.
        Returns:
        the scheduler associated with this transaction instance.
